channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No lanes on roundabout, 5th May
item.description:
Please please please can we have some lanes painted on this roundabout. I regularly have near misses on my commute with other road users changing lanes without realising that’s what they are doing as there are no lines on this roundabout at all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Northfield House Shurdington Road, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tripping hazard outside number 11 kentmere road, 5th May
item.description:
Path

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Kentmere Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: City fibre damaged the grassy area on the corner of liberties and Gloucester Road, 4th May
item.description:
City fibre damaged the grassy area on the corner of liberties and Gloucester Road. Can somebody please tell him to come back and remediate by laying some topsoil and some grass seed thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Libertus Court, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen tree still requires removing, 4th May
item.description:
This tree was blown down at the beginning of the year, you’ve removed it out of the road but it is still on the grass verge and it is in the way. It needs removing as: It’s making the area look scruffy and it’s an eye shore. Health & safety, it’s dangerous as children are constantly climbing on it and pulling branches into the road, which is happening daily now we have lighter evenings. It’s obstructing people from parking in an area where there is already very limited parking available.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 47 Marlstone Drive, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing button not working on station side of Gloucester Road, 4th May
item.description:
Crossing appears to be functional but button to request a crossing does not cause "Wait" light to light up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Station House, 255 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole sinking, 3rd May

item.title: Street light failed + explosion, 3rd May
item.description:
Hallo at 21.00h 03/05/22 there was a car passing the street light opposite no.15. Vittoria Walk and a very loud bang. There was also a faint smell of electrical burning. I checked the immediate area and could only conclude, the loud bang and faint smell of burning must be the street light failure. This light has a yellow neighbourhood watch sign attached and a no."2" in black. All other lights appeared to be working. I would strongly urge immediate checking of this street light to see if there is any electrical failure. The driver of the car did not stop so it was not a collision of any kind. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 20a Vittoria Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gang graffiti, 3rd May
item.description:
‘Gold leaf gang’ and other graffiti up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 137 Swindon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor repair breaking up again., 3rd May
item.description:
Utility work originally done poorly, had bodged repair in March which was breaking up within days of 'repair'. It was reported in March but nothing has been done. Surface continues to break up and potholes are re-forming. Loose gravel from the potholes is making the turn from Hucclecote Road into Chosen Way potentially dangerous for cycles and motorcycles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 29 Hucclecote Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 39 King William Drive, Cheltenham

item.title: Pavement impassable for disabled people, 1st May
item.description:
Tree stump left in pavement. Pavement impassable for wheelchair users, families with buggies. Hazard for blind people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Tamar Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous crossing, 1st May
item.description:
The pedestrian just after the roundabout onto Princess Elizabeth Way needs attention. 4 times in the last 2 months I've been crossing with a pushchair and cars have gone sailing through a red light. It's an accident waiting to happen. I don't know of it's because the crossing is so close to the roundabout that cars aren't aware it's a crossing. Needs to be better signed, or a camera installed to catch those going through a red light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 593 Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken drain on roadside, 1st May
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Ullenwood Park Farm A436, Ullenwood
